00.Opcode Description: This bytecode is used for alignment of 1-byte opcodes and ending ElseIf blocks.

01.Opcode Description: This bytecode ends the current Main/Sub script.

02.Opcode Description: This bytecode moves to the next event in the sequence.

03.Opcode Description: This bytecode chains the current event to the specified next event ID, allowing the script to continue execution from the linked event.

04.Opcode Description: This bytecode executes the specified event with given parameters.

ScdId.Description: Sub Script ID to Jump to

05.Opcode Description: This bytecode terminates the specified event.

06.Opcode Description: This bytecode checks a condition and branches accordingly.

Size.Description: Size of the block to check

07.Opcode Description: This bytecode specifies the size of the block to check if the corresponding Ifel_ck condition is met.

Size.Description: Size of the block to check

08.Opcode Description: This bytecode marks the end of an If/ElseIf/Else block.

09.Opcode Description: This bytecode pauses script execution for the specified duration.

0A.Opcode Description: This bytecode pauses script execution for the specified duration.

0B.Opcode Description: This bytecode used before 0C will wait until the current XA sound has finished playing before proceeding.

0C.Opcode Description: This bytecode used after 0B will wait until the current XA sound has finished playing before proceeding.

0D.Opcode Description: This bytecode begins a for-loop with the specified start and end values.

Size.Description: Size of the block to check

Count.Description: Amount of times block is looped

0E.Opcode Description: This bytecode begins a for-loop with different start and end values.

0F.Opcode Description: This bytecode marks the end of a for-loop.

10.Opcode Description: This bytecode begins a while-loop that continues as long as the specified condition is true.

Condition.Description: Condition to evaluate for loop continuation

11.Opcode Description: This bytecode marks the end of a while-loop.

12.Opcode Description: This bytecode starts a do-while loop.

13.Opcode Description: This bytecode marks the end of a do-while loop.

LoopId.Description: ID of the do-while loop to end

14.Opcode Description: This bytecode begins a switch statement to handle multiple conditions.

15.Opcode Description: This bytecode defines a case within a switch statement.

16.Opcode Description: This bytecode defines the default case within a switch statement.

17.Opcode Description: This bytecode marks the end of a switch statement.

18.Opcode Description: This bytecode jumps to the specified event ID.

19.Opcode Description: This bytecode calls a subroutine (event) and saves the return address.

1A.Opcode Description: This bytecode returns from a subroutine to the saved address.

1B.Opcode Description: This bytecode exits a loop or switch statement.

1C.Opcode Description: This bytecode marks a breakpoint for debugging purposes.

1D.Opcode Description: This bytecode copies data between work registers.

1E.Opcode Description: This bytecode saves the state of the game.

1F.Opcode Description: This bytecode copies data between memory locations.

20.Opcode Description: This bytecode performs a calculation between two operands.

Flag.Description: Memory Location to apply math to

21.Opcode Description: This bytecode performs a second type of calculation.

Value.Description: Value to use in the operation

22.Opcode Description: This bytecode removes an event from the event sequence.

23.Opcode Description: This bytecode is used for alignment of 1-byte opcodes and ending ElseIf blocks.

24.Opcode Description: This bytecode clears the chaser event status.

MapId.Description: ID of the map to open

26.Opcode Description: This bytecode adds points to the score.

27.Opcode Description: This bytecode checks if a door can be used.

28.Opcode Description: This bytecode activates the dying demo for the character.

29.Opcode Description: This bytecode checks the direction of a character or object.

2A.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets parts for a character or object.

2B.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets a vertical loop for the script.

LoopCount.Description: Number of vertical loops to set

2C.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets an OTA (Object Attribute) behavior.

BehaviorId.Description: ID of the behavior to set

2D.Opcode Description: This bytecode starts a line (trajectory or event sequence).

LineId.Description: ID of the line to start

2E.Opcode Description: This bytecode defines the main part of a line (trajectory or event sequence).

2F.Opcode Description: This bytecode ends the current line.

30.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the position of a light source.

31.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the intensity of a light source.

32.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the color of a light source.

33.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the next room the player will enter.

34.Opcode Description: This bytecode controls an Esprite (environment sprite).

35.Opcode Description: This bytecode checks the background music table for the specified value.

36.Opcode Description: This bytecode checks if the player has obtained an item.

ItemId.Description: ID of the item to check

37.Opcode Description: This bytecode reverses the orientation of an object.

38.Opcode Description: This bytecode initializes the life value of the chaser enemy.

39.Opcode Description: This bytecode triggers an explosion effect for specific parts.

3A.Opcode Description: This bytecode causes parts to be destroyed or fall.

PartId.Description: ID of the part to be affected

3B.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets an item for the chaser enemy.

3C.Opcode Description: This bytecode changes the weapon to an old or alternate weapon.

3D.Opcode Description: This bytecode enables a selectable event.

3E.Opcode Description: This bytecode removes an item from the player's inventory.

ItemId.Description: ID of the item to remove

3F.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the floor parameters for the current room.

40.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets member variables or values.

41.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets member variables or values in a secondary register.

42.Opcode Description: This bytecode copies the value from one member variable to another.

43.Opcode Description: This bytecode compares member variables or values.

44.Opcode Description: This bytecode performs a calculation on member variables.

45.Opcode Description: This bytecode performs a secondary calculation on member variables.

46.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the fade parameters for the screen.

ColorR.Description: Red component of the fade color

ColorG.Description: Green component of the fade color

ColorB.Description: Blue component of the fade color

47.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets a work register with a specific value.

Type.Description: Type of Work Set to Select

48.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the speed of a character or object.

49.Opcode Description: This bytecode adds speed to a character or object.

4A.Opcode Description: This bytecode adds angular speed to a character or object.

4B.Opcode Description: This bytecode adds vertical speed to a character or object.

4C.Opcode Description: This bytecode performs a check on certain conditions.

4D.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets a certain value based on conditions.

MemberId.Description: ID of the member to compare

Value.Description: Value to compare the member to

4F.Opcode Description: This bytecode generates a random number.

CutsceneId.Description: ID of the cutscene to change to

51.Opcode Description: This bytecode reverts to the previous cutscene.

52.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the cutscene to play automatically.

53.Opcode Description: This bytecode replaces the current cutscene with a new one.

54.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets a behavior for the cutscene.

55.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the position of a character or object.

56.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the direction of a character or object.

57.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets vibration parameters for the environment or controller.

58.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets an alternate vibration pattern.

59.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets a fade for the vibration effect.

5A.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the RBJ (Room Background JPEG).

RbjId.Description: ID of the RBJ to set

5B.Opcode Description: This bytecode displays a message on screen.

MessageId.Description: ID of the message to display

5D.Opcode Description: This bytecode removes a message from the screen.

5E.Opcode Description: This bytecode starts a screen shake effect.

5F.Opcode Description: This bytecode changes the player's weapon.

WeaponId.Description: ID of the weapon to change to

60.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the door model parameters.

61.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the attributes of a door using AOT (Attribute of Object Type).

62.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the attributes of a four-part door using AOT.

63.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the AOT for an object in the scene.

Data1.Description: Sce_Message / Flag Id / Script Id Init & Complete

64.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the AOT for a four-part object.

65.Opcode Description: This bytecode resets the AOT attributes for an object.

66.Opcode Description: This bytecode activates the AOT for an object.

AOTId.Description: ID of the AOT to activate

67.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the AOT for an item in the scene.

ID.Description: Item instance ID (distinct per item in room)

ItemId.Description: Item ID; which item to spawn.

ObjNo.Description: Model ID; the obj/md1 to use for this item.

68.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the AOT for a four-part item.

69.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets up a shadow (kage) for an object.

6A.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets up super parameters for an object.

6B.Opcode Description: This bytecode checks if the player has kept a specific item.

ItemId.Description: ID of the item to check

6C.Opcode Description: This bytecode checks if the player has a key for a specific door or object.

6D.Opcode Description: This bytecode checks if a trigger is activated.

6E.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets a script ID for the event.

ScriptId.Description: ID of the script to set

6F.Opcode Description: This bytecode triggers a bomb for the object model (OM).

BombId.Description: ID of the bomb to trigger

70.Opcode Description: This bytecode turns on a sprite in the environment.

71.Opcode Description: This bytecode turns on a second sprite in the environment.

72.Opcode Description: This bytecode turns on a 3D sprite in the environment.

73.Opcode Description: This bytecode turns on a second 3D sprite in the environment.

74.Opcode Description: This bytecode kills or disables a sprite in the environment.

SpriteId.Description: ID of the sprite to disable

75.Opcode Description: This bytecode disables a second sprite in the environment.

SpriteId.Description: ID of the second sprite to disable

76.Opcode Description: This bytecode disables all sprites in the environment.

77.Opcode Description: This bytecode plays a sound effect (SE) in the environment.

79.Opcode Description: This bytecode plays a XA sound file.

XaId.Description: ID of the XA sound file

7A.Opcode Description: This bytecode plays a movie or FMV (Full Motion Video) file.

7B.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the background music (BGM) table.

7C.Opcode Description: This bytecode displays the status screen.

7D.Opcode Description: Spawn/set an enemy (EMD) with the specified parameters.

Em_no.Description: Enemy number / room slot (use 0xFF for partner)

EMD_Id.Description: EMD File Id for Em_bin_load() function; Enemy ID/type (last two characters of EMD filename)

AnimFlag.Description: Animation/behavior flag (e.g. 0x08 normal zombie, 0x44 partner, 0x80 frozen)

7E.Opcode Description: This bytecode divides the water effect into multiple sections.

DivisionCount.Description: Number of divisions for the water effect

7F.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets an object model (OM) with specific parameters.

80.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the motion of a player character or object.

Mode.Description: Mode to set the motion to

81.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the destination for a player character or object.

82.Opcode Description: This bytecode controls the neck movement of a player character or object.

83.Opcode Description: This bytecode returns control to the player or AI for the current object.

84.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets a flag for a player character or object.

85.Opcode Description: This bytecode equips or changes the gun for a player character.

GunId.Description: ID of the gun to equip

86.Opcode Description: This bytecode removes or deactivates the gun for a player character.

87.Opcode Description: This bytecode stops the current motion of a player character or object.

88.Opcode Description: This bytecode rotates a player character or object to a specified angle.

89.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets a counter for a player character or object.

8A.Opcode Description: This bytecode returns control to the main script for a sub-process.

8B.Opcode Description: This bytecode starts a sub-process for a specific scene.

8C.Opcode Description: This bytecode starts a specific process for the player character.

8D.Opcode Description: This bytecode changes the weapon in a special sub-process.

8E.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the motion number for a player character or object.

8F.Opcode Description: This bytecode resets the enemy (Em) parameters to their default state.

EnemyId.Description: ID of the enemy to reset
